dt: {bc}to improve or expand (something, such as a literary work) as if by stuffing

et: Middle English {it}farsen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}farsir{/it}, from Latin {it}farcire{/it}
shortdef: to improve or expand (something, such as a literary work) as if by stuffing

dt: {bc}a light dramatic composition marked by broadly satirical comedy and improbable plot
{bc}an empty or patently ridiculous act, proceeding, or situation

et: Middle English {it}farse{/it}, from Middle French {it}farce{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*farsa{/it}, from Latin, feminine of {it}farsus{/it}, past participle of {it}farcire{/it}
shortdef: a light dramatic composition marked by broadly satirical comedy and improbable plot
the broad humor characteristic of farce
